page.title: 07 RAINFORD INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: Rainford Industrial Estate is the property of John Kitchener.The estate itself covers approximately 1 square km and the majority of the companies deal in metals.There are six main metal companies:Rainford Metals which specializes in metal enclosures and has a work-force of 125;Welding Units U.K.: a company involved in flanges and piping with 50 employees;and Rainford Fastenings or "Royden" which is a structural engineering firm.Royden's was built in 1964 when the old building burnt down,and "Pilkington's Sandwash" once stood on the same spot where sand was collected in order to make glass. The other metal industries are Copper Craft:a metal spinning company who deal in such metals as stainless steel,mild steel,titanium and copper;and Beverston Engineering Ltd.:a subsiduary company of Rainford Metals.
